summary: If we’re going by the idea that because Michael Sheen played Robbie Ross in ‘Wilde’, Aziraphale is Robbie Ross then I like the...
body:
If we’re going by the idea that because Michael Sheen played Robbie Ross in ‘Wilde’, Aziraphale is Robbie Ross then I like the idea that Michael Sheen’s other biopic roles follow that rule

By that logic, Aziraphale:

  • Was Oscar Wilde’s first lover (Robbie Ross, ‘Wilde’)
  • Was manager of Derby, Leeds, and Nottingham Forest football clubs among others (Brian Clough, ‘The Damned United’)
  • Interviewed Richard Nixon about the Watergate scandal (David Frost, ‘Frost/Nixon’)
  • Was prime minister of the United Kingdom (Tony Blair, ‘The Queen’)
  • Appeared in 26 ‘Carry On’ films (Kenneth Williams, ‘Fantabulosa!’)
  • Was the literal emperor of Rome (Nero, ‘Ancient Rome: The Rise and Fall of an Empire’)
  • Revolutionised the science fiction genre (H. G. Wells, ‘War with the World’)

reblog.comment:

  • Was manager of Derby, Leeds, and Nottingham Forest football clubs among others (Brian Clough, ‘The Damned United’)
  • Interviewed Richard Nixon about the Watergate scandal (David Frost, ‘Frost/Nixon’)
  • Was prime minister of the United Kingdom (Tony Blair, ‘The Queen’)
  • Appeared in 26 ‘Carry On’ films (Kenneth Williams, ‘Fantabulosa!’)
  • Was the literal emperor of Rome (Nero, ‘Ancient Rome: The Rise and Fall of an Empire’)
  • Revolutionised the science fiction genre (H. G. Wells, ‘War with the World’)

trail.content_raw:
If we’re going by the idea that because Michael Sheen played Robbie Ross in ‘Wilde’, Aziraphale is Robbie Ross then I like the idea that Michael Sheen’s other biopic roles follow that rule

By that logic, Aziraphale:

  • Was Oscar Wilde’s first lover (Robbie Ross, ‘Wilde’)
  • Was manager of Derby, Leeds, and Nottingham Forest football clubs among others (Brian Clough, ‘The Damned United’)
  • Interviewed Richard Nixon about the Watergate scandal (David Frost, ‘Frost/Nixon’)
  • Was prime minister of the United Kingdom (Tony Blair, ‘The Queen’)
  • Appeared in 26 ‘Carry On’ films (Kenneth Williams, ‘Fantabulosa!’)
  • Was the literal emperor of Rome (Nero, ‘Ancient Rome: The Rise and Fall of an Empire’)
  • Revolutionised the science fiction genre (H. G. Wells, ‘War with the World’)
trail.content:
If we’re going by the idea that because Michael Sheen played Robbie Ross in ‘Wilde’, Aziraphale is Robbie Ross then I like the idea that Michael Sheen’s other biopic roles follow that rule

By that logic, Aziraphale:

  • Was Oscar Wilde’s first lover (Robbie Ross, ‘Wilde’)
  • Was manager of Derby, Leeds, and Nottingham Forest football clubs among others (Brian Clough, ‘The Damned United’)
  • Interviewed Richard Nixon about the Watergate scandal (David Frost, ‘Frost/Nixon’)
  • Was prime minister of the United Kingdom (Tony Blair, ‘The Queen’)
  • Appeared in 26 ‘Carry On’ films (Kenneth Williams, ‘Fantabulosa!’)
  • Was the literal emperor of Rome (Nero, ‘Ancient Rome: The Rise and Fall of an Empire’)
  • Revolutionised the science fiction genre (H. G. Wells, ‘War with the World’)

summary:
"So what I want to know is, where did all the fish come from?" asked the sergeant.
"I told you. They fell from the sky. One...
body:
“So what I want to know is, where did all the fish come from?” asked the sergeant.

“I told you. They fell from the sky. One minute I’m driving along at sixty, next second, whap! a twelve-pound salmon smashes through the windscreen. So I pulls the wheel over, and I skidded on that,” he pointed to the remains of a hammerhead shark under the lorry, “and ran into that.” That was a thirty-foot-high heap of fish, of different shapes and sizes.

“Have you been drinking, sir?” asked the sergeant, less than hopefully.

“Course I haven’t been drinking, you great wazzock. You can see the fish, can’t you?”

On the top of the pile a rather large octopus waved a languid tentacle at them. The sergeant resisted the temptation to wave back.

On the top of the pile a rather large octopus waved a languid tentacle at them. The sergeant resisted the temptation to wave back.

tags: azi is like a comfortable old sofa :)
summary: Question: How was it preparing for a role to play an angel? Michael Sheen: Well, you sort of can’t play an angel, you know, you...
caption:
Question: How was it preparing for a role to play an angel?

Michael Sheen: Well, you sort of can’t play an angel, you know, you kind of have to find little details to try and connect with. So I thought about, well, if I was on Earth for thousands of years what would I enjoy about that. And, well, Aziraphale is someone who really enjoyes quality when it comes to clothes and things, so even though Crowley just like makes up his clothes and he always looks fashionable, I wanted Aziraphale to look like he picked things up over the years. You know, so the nice waistcoat from the Victorian era or a nice jacket from the Edwardian era and he kept that. So that kind of built up the look of the character and I like the idea that he’s like a comfortable old sofa, but as a person.

And also thinking about, well, if he’s an angel then he’s love, you know, he just is a creature of love, so how does that affect his realionship with Crowley who’s supposed to be on the opposite side of. He just can’t help but love him as well at the same time.

So you sort of focus on those kinds of things rather than kind of label of angel.

reblog.comment:

You know, so the nice waistcoat from the Victorian era or a nice jacket from the Edwardian era and he kept that. So that kind of built up the look of the character and I like the idea that he’s like a comfortable old sofa, but as a person.

And also thinking about, well, if he’s an angel then he’s love, you know, he just is a creature of love, so how does that affect his realionship with Crowley who’s supposed to be on the opposite side of. He just can’t help but love him as well at the same time.

So you sort of focus on those kinds of things rather than kind of label of angel.

So that kind of built up the look of the character and I like the idea that he’s like a comfortable old sofa, but as a person.

You know, so the nice waistcoat from the Victorian era or a nice jacket from the Edwardian era and he kept that.
